extendedInfo.description: A to-do list and notebook for power users, which syncs with Toodledo and Google Tasks / gTasks.This is the smartphone edition.  We also have a separate tablet edition for devices with large screens.This is a 14 day free trial.  After the trial, a license may be purchased for $5.ORGANIZE:- Organize tasks by folder, location, context, tags, goal, star, and subtasks.- Supports complex repeating patterns (for example: every Tuesday and Thursday).- Track both estimated and actual length of tasks.  Includes a built-in timer.- Organize your notes into folders.- Link your tasks with contacts on your device. Allows you to quickly call, e-mail, or navigate to someone right from your to-do list.- 2 home screen widgets: a task list (in multiple sizes), and a new task buttonSYNCHRONIZE:- Synchronizes with Toodledo.com and Google Tasks / gTasks, allowing access from both your desktop computer and handset.  Supports all features supported by Toodledo and Google.- Supports multiple accounts.- Automatic synchronization, including instant upload of changes on your phone to Toodledo and Google.- Supports subtasks without a paid Toodledo Pro account. (Subtask syncing requires a Toodledo Pro or Google account.)- Optionally view your tasks on your device's calendar.PRIORITIZE:- Includes 5 priority levels and a task status field (active, planning, waiting, etc.).- Option to set a time based and/or location based reminder (proximity alert) for a task.  When linking a task with a location, a location alarm will occur when you reach that location.- Optional nagging alarms remind you again if you don't hear the sound or feel the vibration.- Custom vibrate patterns, sounds, and light colors allow you to distinguish a task alarm from other alarms.- Snooze alarms until later if you can't do the task right away.CUSTOMIZE:- Filter and search on any task field.- Sort by up to 3 levels, on any task field.- Configurable display allows you to see the exact information you are interested in.- Save your filter, sort, and display options into custom views for quick access later.- Customizable interface: Turn off the features you don't want to keep things simple.- Choice of light or dark theme.

reviews.title: Great program
reviews.comment: Reliable, good features, intuitive - much better than the other todo apps I tried
reviews.author: Brian Oberdorf

reviews.title: Best app for Toodledo & GTD integration
reviews.comment: Have tried all ios and Android apps that sync with Toodledo and this does the best job of them all.  Great options, clean layout and works perfectly with a GTD setup.  Particularly like the ability to create saved searches.
reviews.author: wj lynch

reviews.title: Excellent Toodledo that you can customize
reviews.comment: Excellent app with flawless sync with Toodledo.  I use the custom views on my home screen to organize my tasks.  Great app, hope it gets some updates soon.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Overall good, but contexts
reviews.comment: I was looking for an todo list manager on android equivalent to Appigo Todo on iOS. This one is the closest I have found. One aspect I find lacking is the implementation of contexts. While you can statically include context in a filter for any view, it doesn\'t make sense to me. I should be able to set my current context globally, and have it apply to all views. Otherwise, seems like a good app.
reviews.author: Martin Hill

reviews.title: Best To List Out There
reviews.comment: I love thus app. I run a contracting business with multiple teams working on multiple projects in multiple areas. My list grow and change quickly. This app gives me the opportunity to stay on top of all of it!
reviews.author: Ernie Starr

reviews.title: Powerful To-Do App
reviews.comment: Sync with google task. Ability to store various details but need improvement on UI big time . Clumsy and slow to manipulate and read. Easier to view with Calegoo or Tasks.
reviews.author: Witoon Worasettakankij

reviews.title: Great; supports everything I need from Toodledo
reviews.comment: I use a lot of features in Toodledo, namely custom searches, filters on context, folder, start date and tags, and this handles them all effortlessly. Will probably purchase at the end of my 14 days trial (which by the way is a *brilliant* way to handle payments!)
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: My favorite and most used app
reviews.comment: One of the only apps I\'ve seen that truly lets you own your data. Exports to xml & csv. Automated backups. Syncs with tootoledo.  Customized views.  Notes seem to be better organized than Evernote.   The palm import was a great option for initial migration as well.
reviews.author: Paul Otte

reviews.title: So ugly
reviews.comment: I\'m sorry. This app is so ugly I can\'t bear to use it. I would have bought the pro version if it it had the holo theme.
reviews.author: Ryan Hart

reviews.title: Best To-Do App for Customization
reviews.comment: Best To-Do App forCustomization! All other apps are useless simple lists. Great for projects!
reviews.author: Ken Zenk

reviews.title: Functionality = good; Interface = not good
reviews.comment: This is a very functional and stable app, I\'ve had no problems with it or with Toodledo synchronization. That said, please update the interface! It\'s just very unpleasant to look at/work with, and I\'m in this app all the time. UI is a big deal. Even the notification icon needs work. Other than that, this really is a good app.  Update: no app updates in quite a while, still waiting for the app to adhere to Google\'s UI standards, Holo UI would be nice...
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Useful, solid app
reviews.comment: I\'ve tried virtually every app in Play for handling tasks AND syncing with Toodledo. If you use Toodledo and Android, then this is a great app.  Very solid.  Supports pretty much every feature of Toodledo, but also lets you choose which features you want to use. If there\'s one thing it lacks is a certain style consistent with good UI design (for Android).  It would be nice if one could tweak the widgets and the overall interface more, to make it look consistent with other mods people tend to do (e.g. change font, colours, sizes, margins, etc).
reviews.author: Filippo Salustri

reviews.title: Very reliable
reviews.comment: This app never crashes, it just works. Toodledo support is excellent.UI isn\'t exactly beautiful, but don\'t judge it by its looks.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: By far the best TODO app - understands start date!
reviews.comment: By far the best TODO app  - understands start date  - understands filtering  - understands complex sorting  - can be set up to match Toodledo (ie filters and sorts)
reviews.author: Paul Jones

reviews.title: Outstanding!!!
reviews.comment: After wasting my time on about four other \"highly recommended\" To Do lists, I found this gem. Even though I have a pretty complex work management scheme running within this app, setting it up was relatively effortless. Being able to backup locally to my SD card is a great relief, as I have had other cloud-synch-only To Do Lists dump all my data.   $5.00 is really not much money if it gains you hours per week in efficiency.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: UI too busy-Not for me
reviews.comment: Gave this a try but it just wasn\'t for me. Installed and ran fine but I found that the app screens were just too busy.  I was using it with Toodledo, and I\'ve gone back to using the mobile site. Worth trying out though.
reviews.author: John Hardy

reviews.title: Great todo for toodledo web app.
reviews.comment: Great application. I have been using this app as a client for toodledo web app. It works great. Lots of customization you can do to suit your test. But this app is lacking the holo theme of the JB or ICS. It is using different layout. This app would be great if it can support the JB user control or theme.  5 star when it updates the JB theme.
reviews.author: Priyank Patel

reviews.title: Excellent app. Gets better with use.
reviews.comment: A feature rich, reliable app that sync flawlessly with Toodledo. It offers all the views that I am interested in and more. I have used many other to-do apps and this one is probably the best one for me. I am still discovering many features that I can use after 5 months of using it. Highly recommended!
reviews.author: realmocca realmocca

reviews.title: ONE OF TOP THREE!
reviews.comment: 3rd place goes to Ultimate ToDo, very close 1st and 2nd... but second goes to Check it off and First goes to Checkmark only because of it\'s hierarchy of subtasks and action inclusion of contacts, email or a map for each task. Ultimate ToDo lacks pleasant interface, home page cluttered with icons and is somewhat confusing (too many options!). Widget a little to simple, however overall it is one of the Top three ToDo List Apps. It does include simple subtask, notes and good filter system, task timer, goals.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Good functionality but...
reviews.comment: Not far off 5* but the interface is pretty poor IMO. The second screen shot used to advertise this in Play labelled \"All Tasks\" (the one with the black background) bears testament to this. If you have a handset with a large amount of [[oh God I can\'t believe I\'m about to use this terminology but...]] \"real estate\" then it\'s ok, well bearable but if you don\'t it\'s just too cluttered and overwhelming. There are too many options on display that do not look related or are there by design.   I came to this software from GTD methodology \"Getting Things Done\", so a clean looking, slick interface is most necessary. Just take a look at the screen shots for Things\302\256 made for IOS (iphone) to see how it could and should be done, then we\'ll have a winner because the customisation possibilities here are excellent.   (In fact I\'d recommend people like me that struggle with self organisation read GTD by David Allen as this software is all too easy to get bogged down by using too many options and have no clear path to make the software work for you- as I did first time around.
reviews.author: A Google User
